MP3, WAV ringtones | connectivity = [[Wi-Fi]] 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac (2.4/5GHz), VHT80, [[MU-MIMO]], 1024-QAM [[Bluetooth 5.0]] (LE up to 2Mbit/s), ANT+, [[USB-C]], [[Near-field communication|NFC]], location ([[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Galileo (satellite navigation)|Galileo]], [[GLONASS]], [[BeiDou Navigation Satellite System|BeiDou]]) | other = [[2G]], [[3G]], [[LTE (telecommunication)|LTE]], [[LTE-A]] | sar = | hac = | website = {{URL|https://www.oppo.com/en/smartphone-find_x}} | references = |logo=Oppo Find X wordmark.svg}} The '''Oppo Find X '''is the 2018 flagship [[smartphone]] from the [[Oppo phones#Oppo Find Series|Oppo Find]] series and was launched on 19 June 2018 in Paris by [[Oppo]]. The Find X features a different design from traditional smartphones, as it has a mechanic pop-up camera.{{Cite news|url=https://www.techradar.com/news/oppo-find-x-launches-with-no-notch-almost-no-bezel-and-three-pop-up-cameras|title=Oppo Find X launches with no notch, almost no bezel and three pop-up cameras|work=TechRadar|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en}} The phone has a screen to body ratio of 87%, the thinnest [[bezel (screen)|bezels]] in the market when it launched, and is considered the first "all screen" smartphone to be released.{{Cite news|url=https://www.digitaltrends.com/mobile/bezel-less-phone-comparison/|title=Here's our comparison of the most bezel-less designs among smartphones|date=2018-06-22|work=Digital Trends|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}} ==Specifications== ===Hardware=== It is powered by [[Qualcomm Snapdragon]] 845 processor, 8 GB of [[RAM]], 256 GB of storage and operates on [[Android 8.1]] (Oreo) which is [[Color OS]] customised.{{cite web|url=https://www.gsmarena.com/oppo_find_x-7885.php|title=Oppo Find X - Full phone specifications|website=www.gsmarena.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-21}} The pop up contains both the 25 MP front camera and dual 16 + 20 MP rear cameras. It also has a 3,730 [[mAh]] battery and is powered by [[VOOC]] fast wired charging. The [[Lamborghini]] edition of the phone comes with 512 GB storage and supports SuperVOOC fast wired charging which can charge from 0 to 100% in 35 minutes.{{cite web|url=https://www.androidauthority.com/oppo-find-x-lamborghini-edition-877748/|title=Oppo Find X Lamborghini Edition revealed with super-fast battery charging|website=www.androidauthority.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-21}} According to Oppo, Find X will be its first phone to have global [[LTE (telecommunication)|LTE]] compatibility which is crucial for the company to enter the European and North American market, the phone supports no [[fingerprint scanner]] to unlock the device and instead relies on [[Facial recognition system|facial recognition]] known as O-Face, which is done by the pop up taking as little as 0.5 s to pop up and unlock the phone.{{cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/circuitbreaker/2018/6/19/17476338/oppo-find-x-phone-announcement-specs-price|title=Oppo's Find X ditches the notch for pop-up cameras|website=www.theverge.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-21}} It is the first phone to feature an entirely virtualized (software-driven) proximity sensor, as there was no space on the front face to include such a physical sensor. The selfie camera has 3D Smart Selfie Capture that can simulate various lighting effects for portrait lighting and it has an 3D OMoji feature while the dual rear camera can recognize 800 scenes in 20 scenarios (Food, Pets, Snow, etc.). {{cite web|url=http://manilastandardtoday.com/tech/gadgets/268547/oppo-find-x-exploring-infinite-potential-of-technology-and-art.html |title=OPPO Find X: Exploring Infinite Potential of Technology and Art - Manila Standard |publisher=Manilastandardtoday.com |date=2018-06-20 |access-date=2018-09-04}} ===Software=== Oppo Find X ships with Android 8.1 Oreo. == See also == * [[Oppo phones]] == References == {{reflist}} {{BBK Electronics}} [[Category:Android (operating system) devices]] [[Category:Mobile phones introduced in 2018]] [[Category:Mobile phones with multiple rear cameras]] [[Category:Mobile phones with 4K video recording]] [[Category:Discontinued flagship smartphones]] [[Category:Oppo smartphones]]
